p: Shikimic acid is synthesized from a combination of phosphoenolpyruvate (via glycolysis) with 4-phosphate erythrosis (pathways pentoses or photosynthesis) and is a precursor to hydrolyzabletannins, coumarins, alkaloids derived from aromatic amino acids and phenylpropanoids, compounds that have the presence of an aromatic ring in common. These compounds are produced by the biochemical route called the shikimate pathway [ 70].
